348.title: Russia wants to free up troops by not storming Mariupol steel plant: UK
348.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's decision to blockade the Azovstal steel plant "likely indicates a desire to contain Ukrainian resistance in Mariupol and free up Russian forces to be deployed elsewhere in eastern Ukraine", UK's Defence Ministry said. Storming the plant "would likely incur significant Russian casualties", further decreasing their [Russia's] overall combat effectiveness, it added.

349.title: 5 held for man's death during Ram Navami procession in MP's Khargone
349.article_body: As many as five people have been arrested in connection with a 30-year-old man's death during the Ram Navami procession on April 10 in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, police said. The victim, a municipal employee, had been missing since the April 10 violence. His body was found eight days later at a morgue in Indore, police had said earlier.

350.title: Start filling B'luru potholes immediately: K'taka HC to contractor
350.article_body: Karnataka High Court has directed a contractor, American Road Technology and Solutions Private Limited, to start filling potholes in the city "immediately" as per BBMP's order. The contractor had sought that the BBMP pay PWD rates and reportedly make an advance payment. The court asked the BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta to consider the same and take appropriate action.

351.title: I tried to have my cake & eat it too, failed: Musk on starting Tesla, SpaceX together
351.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "My true moral error was creating Tesla and SpaceX at same time." He said that he avoided general management-related work at the electric vehicle maker Tesla and focused only on product and engineering. "Tried to have my cake and eat it too, which failed," Musk, who is currently the world's richest person, added.

352.title: 2 kill man for not printing their pics in hoardings in Pune; held
352.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly attacking a man with an iron hammer, leading to his death, in a dispute over not printing the duo's pictures on hoardings on the occasion of Ambedkar Jayanti in Pune. The accused had attacked the man and his friend on April 19. The man had succumbed to his injuries on Thursday at a hospital.

353.title: PMPML contractors go on strike today, over 700 buses go off road in Pune
353.article_body: The private buses contractors of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) have called for a strike today due to some payment issues with the transport authority. The strike has meant that out of around 1,500 buses owned by the PMPML, over 700 are not available for commuters today in Pune. However, the protesting contractors are served with notices, officials said.

354.title: Social media's design is tilting us in the wrong direction: Obama
354.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama, while discussing social media platforms and disinformation at a conference, said, "The very design of these platforms is tilting us in the wrong direction." He warned that citizens no longer know "what to believe" due to false information spreading online. "Disinformation is a threat to our democracy," Obama said.

355.title: Saliva laced with gutkha corroding Howrah Bridge: IAS officer to Ajay, SRK as he shares pic
355.article_body: Amid controversy over gutkha brand endorsements, IAS officer Awanish Sharan tweeted, "Kolkata Port Trust has said saliva laced with gutkha is corroding the iconic 70-year-old bridge. The Howrah Bridge is under attack from gutkha-chewers." He also shared a picture of a bridge pillar soiled with gutkha-laced spit and tagged actors Ajay Devgn, Shah Rukh Khan, Akshay Kumar and Amitabh Bachchan.

356.title: We lost a baby via surrogacy, reveals actress Amrita Rao
356.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband RJ Anmol, while sharing their pregnancy struggle, revealed they tried many methods to embrace parenthood. They revealed they had opted for surrogacy but a few days later, they were informed the baby was no more. "Aspiring parents, I don't think you need to be so emotional. This is not in our hands," Amrita stated.

357.title: IPL share video of Dhoni smashing 16 runs off last 4 balls to finish the run chase
357.article_body: IPL shared a video of CSK's MS Dhoni finishing the run chase against MI by smashing 16 runs off the last four deliveries. Dhoni slammed a six on the third ball of last over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, followed by a four, a double and a four. "Final over finesse: An MS Dhoni masterclass seals it for CSK," IPL wrote.

358.title: Govt may cut LIC IPO size by 40% as it looks to raise ₹30,000 crore: Report
358.article_body: The government is looking to raise ₹30,000 crore through the initial public offering (IPO) of state-run Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), Bloomberg reported. This is about 40% lower than the previous estimates of over ₹50,000 crore. However, it is still poised to be India's biggest IPO to date. As per reports, LIC will be valued at ₹6 lakh crore.

359.title: Bride, caterer arrested for lacing wedding food with marijuana in US
359.article_body: A bride and her wedding caterer have been arrested for allegedly serving marijuana-laced food at her February wedding as a prank in US' Florida, local media reported. Police had reportedly arrived at the wedding venue after several guests called emergency services feeling unwell. The duo has been charged with negligence, delivery of marijuana, and violating state laws against food tampering.

360.title: Ex-WWE stars Karrion Kross and Scarlett get married on top of glacier, share video
360.article_body: Former WWE stars Karrion Kross and Scarlett Bordeaux tie the knot on top of a glacier in Alaska. The duo took to their respective Instagram accounts to share pictures and video from the ceremony. "We flew to Alaska, hopped on a helicopter and flew to a glacier for a very private ceremony (then wrestled the next day, naturally)," wrote Kross.

361.title: Ranbir & Rashmika Mandanna's 'Animal' goes on floors in Manali
361.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna-starrer 'Animal' went on the floors in Manali on Friday. The upcoming action film, directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga of 'Kabir Singh' fame, will also feature Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol among others in pivotal roles. Backed by Bhushan Kumar and Pranay Reddy Vanga, 'Animal' is expected to release in theatres on August 11, 2023.

362.title: Ukraine Vice PM shares 'facepalm' emoji on Russia banning Zuckerberg
362.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov, on Twitter, shared a 'facepalm' emoji while saying that Russia had imposed sanctions on Mark Zuckerberg. Russia has banned 29 Americans, including Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, from entering Russia. Earlier, Russia had protested against Meta allowing users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war.

363.title: I have the Indian jab in my arm: UK PM on taking Covishield vaccine
363.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson, who's on a two-day visit to India, on Friday revealed that he has taken the Covishield COVID-19 vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India. Talking about getting vaccinated with the vaccine developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca, Johnson said, "I have the Indian jab in my arm." He added, "Many thanks to India."

364.title: Probe sources of properties of Jahangirpuri violence accused: Police to ED
364.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday asked Enforcement Directorate (ED) to probe the sources of properties of Ansar Sheikh, an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence. "He reportedly owns a big mansion in West Bengal...does a lot of charity for his community. We suspect he frequently receives money via shady channels," police said. "We're also looking into his links with terrorists," police added.

365.title: BJP slams Cong govt for demolishing 300-yr-old Shiva temple in Alwar
365.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Friday slammed Rajasthan's Congress government for allegedly demolishing a 300-year-old Shiva temple in Alwar as a part of an anti-encroachment drive. BJP leader Amit Malviya accused Congress of demolishing temples in the name of development. "Shedding tears on Karauli...Jahangirpuri and hurting the faith of Hindus - this is the secularism of Congress," he tweeted.

366.title: 18 more test COVID-19 +ve at IIT Madras, total cases now at 30
366.article_body: At least 18 more students tested positive for coronavirus on Friday at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras, which is located in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The total number of positive cases in the institute has now risen to 30. This comes as India saw a rise in coronavirus cases for the third day in a row with 2,451 cases.

367.title: Tamil Nadu makes face masks mandatory again; violators to be fined ₹500
367.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday issued an order making face masks at public places mandatory again. According to the order issued by the state Health Department, a fine of ₹500 will be imposed on violators. The department said the decision was taken in view of the rising COVID-19 cases across the country, especially in Delhi.

368.title: Rider was overspeeding, nothing wrong with scooter: Ola on Guwahati accident
368.article_body: Ola Electric issued a statement with a graph that showed the speed data of the scooter that was involved in an accident in which the owner alleged that his son sustained injuries due to the faulty vehicle in Guwahati. It said, "the rider was overspeeding...He braked in panic, thereby losing control of the vehicle. There's nothing wrong with the vehicle."

369.title: Will take serious view of demolitions in Jahangirpuri that took place after our order: SC
369.article_body: In the Jahangirpuri demolition matter, the Supreme Court on Thursday said, "Will take a serious view of all demolitions that took place after our status quo decision was communicated to the mayor." The demolition, which started around 10.15 am, went on for two hours despite the Supreme Court's directions at 11 am that status quo be maintained.

370.title: Filmmaking is tougher now, everyone is a critic: Ajay Devgn
370.article_body: Ajay Devgn in a recent interview said it is tough to make a film now as compared to the 90s. "Earlier, filmmaking was a lot of fun...There was no pressure of whether the film will work or not," the actor said adding, "Now, everyone is a critic." Ajay further said that international exposure has made the industry quality conscious.

371.title: GB Nagar Police takes action against 17 DJ operators for violating norms
371.article_body: The GB Nagar Police seized the vehicles of 17 DJ operators, who were found violating noise pollution norms in the district. Despite serving notices about the permitted decibel levels to control noise pollution, the DJ operators continued to play loud music, the police said. The police is also issuing notices to religious places, marriage halls to control sound limit.

372.title: More funding needed to roll out malaria vaccine, warns Oxford chief
372.article_body: More government funding is needed to roll out the world's most effective malaria vaccine in Africa, where malaria is the leading cause of death in children and infants, Oxford's Professor Hill, who developed the jab, warned. "It seems extraordinary...that we can't find the money to get Africa out of the horrendous mortality that it's been suffering for decades," he said.

373.title: I felt like Sachin Tendulkar, Amitabh Bachchan: UK PM on India welcome
373.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who is in India on a two-day visit, said, "I thank PM Narendra Modi and the people of India for the grand welcome. I felt like Sachin Tendulkar upon my arrival and also like Amitabh Bachchan when I saw hoardings everywhere." Today, Johnson held talks on UK and India's strategic defence, diplomatic and economic partnership.

374.title: Sachin said 'Don't be afraid of failure, just be yourself': Kishan
374.article_body: Recalling his conversation with Sachin Tendulkar after MI's loss against LSG, MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said, "He just told me to be myself...There should be no fear of failure." Kishan scored 13 runs off 17 balls against LSG. He was dismissed for a golden duck against CSK. Kishan has scored 191 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

375.title: 35-year-old man shot dead by bike-borne assailant in Gurugram
375.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by a bike-borne assailant in Gurugram's Bilaspur Khurd village. According to police, the deceased, identified as Deepak, was present outside a house he had put on rent when he was fired upon. The accused then tried to flee, however, he was caught by Deepak's cousin brothers who handed him over to the police.

376.title: Hardik takes the bull by its horns, he is IPL 2022's best captain so far: Hogg
376.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said GT captain Hardik Pandya has been IPL 2022's best captain so far, adding that he won't be "surprised" if Hardik leads India in white-ball cricket "in two years". "Hardik takes the bull by its horns...He will [take]...the ball when the game is on the line and he is up against the best batter," stated Hogg.

377.title: Lives of 1 lakh trapped civilians in Mariupol are in Putin's hands: Mayor
377.article_body: The lives of about 1,00,000 civilians still trapped in Ukraine's war-torn Mariupol are in Russian President Vladimir Putin's hands, the city's Mayor Vadym Boichenko told Reuters. He added that satellite images released of a mass grave site by US company Maxar Technologies near Mariupol were proof that Russian forces were burying bodies to try to hide the death toll.

378.title: 14-yr-old boy dead, minor friend critical after accident while riding bike in Thane
378.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died and his 16-year-old friend was left critically injured after the motorbike they were riding was hit by an unidentified vehicle on Vanjarpatti flyover in Thane's Bhiwandi. "We'll find out who the bike's owner is and take appropriate action against the person, as it's against the law to give your vehicle to minors," a police officer said.

379.title: B'luru teen makes platform to support COVID-19 affected women
379.article_body: A 17-year-old girl, Anika Midha, has built non-profit organisation Willow Fund to help support women affected by COVID-19 and showcase work by women artisans from rural areas. "I used my sense of resilience to dream of...better future for women artisans," Midha said. Furthermore, Willow Fund provided financial support to two engineering students who lost primary earning family members to COVID-19.

380.title: Several cheated of ₹12 crore via bogus Pune poultry firm website, YouTube channel
380.article_body: A case has been lodged against cyber fraudsters for allegedly cheating several investors of over ₹12 crore by creating a bogus website and YouTube channel using a Pune-based leading poultry firm's name and logo. Police said the fraudsters posted a fake advertisement regarding an investment scheme and appealed to people to invest money after promising them lucrative financial returns.

381.title: Over 50 houses, shops gutted in fire in Arunachal Pradesh
381.article_body: More than 50 houses and shops were gutted after a fire broke out in Yingkiong's upper market area in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang on Thursday, state Health Minister Alo Libang said. "Properties worth around ₹4 crore have been damaged as being assessed by the district administration," he added. The fire affected about 120 to 175 people, Libang stated.

382.title: Ranbir, Alia wanted to get into 'A-list' WhatsApp group, we rejected them: Johar
382.article_body: Karan Johar said he's part of WhatsApp group called 'A-list', which has a few of his friends whose name starts with 'A'. He added they discuss all the latest trailers and films. "Ranbir, Alia tried...hard to get into [it]...but we rejected them, Ayan [Mukerji] said no...stars...We might have opinions on their movies...which we don't want them to know," said Johar.

383.title: Over 6 cr members enrol for Cong's internal polls to elect new president
383.article_body: Over six crore Congress members have enrolled themselves to participate in the party's organisational elections, Congress Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said. "Around 2.6 crore members were enrolled through digital membership. Membership has been done through papers too," he said. The party will get a new president by the end of September 2022, Mistry further said.

384.title: What are RBI's new guidelines for credit and debit cards effective from July 1?
384.article_body: Among the various guidelines, some include no hidden charges on a credit card issued free of charge. While banks won't force customers to avail debit cards, any changes in credit card charges shall be intimated to the users 30 days prior to their implementation. Notably, reasons for rejecting credit card applications shall be given in writing to the user.

385.title: No power born in India to divide country: Salman Khurshid
385.article_body: Senior Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said that "no power has been born to divide the country of India". "My opinion is clear...A few people can confuse the public but the soul of the country cannot be broken because there is no force to break India," Khurshid said. "This belief should never be allowed to get hurt," he added.

386.title: I've faced a lot of rejections: Ramayan actor Sunil's son on star-kid tag
386.article_body: Actor Krish Pathak, son of 'Ramayan' actor Sunil Lahri, said in an interview that he never saw himself as a 'star-kid'. "I have had a lot of struggles and rejections but I never took those rejections seriously," he added. Krish further said he doesn't believe that he will get anything on a platter because of his father.

387.title: US man dies of brain infection after contracting rare virus spread by ticks
387.article_body: A man in Maine, US died after suffering a brain infection from the rare Powassan virus that he contracted from tick bite. The virus creates a dangerous brain infecting virus that causes severe neurological symptoms. No cure, vaccine or antiviral treatment has been discovered yet to treat the virus. Experts have advised locals to take steps that prevent tick bites.

388.title: 2 Pak terrorists of JeM's suicide squad killed in Jammu: J&K DGP
388.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh said on Friday that two Pakistani terrorists of Jaish-e-Mohammed's (JeM) suicide squad were killed in Jammu's Sunjwan. This comes as terrorists attacked a bus carrying 15 CISF personnel there and one ASI lost his life. "This is part of...larger conspiracy to disturb peace in Jammu and sabotage [PM Narendra Modi's] visit," Singh added.

389.title: Turkey's Oppn leader left without electricity after refusing to pay bills
389.article_body: The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, who has refused to pay his electricity bills in protest of high household energy prices, said authorities have cut off the power supply to his home on Thursday. "Energy is a basic human right. It's like bread...water...[and] air," Kemal Kilicdaroglu said, adding, "I wanted to be the voice of those who cannot pay."

390.title: Temple-like structure found during mosque renovation in Mangaluru
390.article_body: A temple-like architectural design has been discovered underneath an old mosque in Mangaluru's Malali. The structure was identified when the renovation work at Juma Masjid was underway. "The District administration is looking into the old land records and entries regarding the ownership details. We will take reports from endowment department and Waqf Board," Deputy Commissioner Rajendra KV said.

391.title: Man killed in celebratory firing at a wedding in Lakhimpur Kheri
391.article_body: A man was killed during a celebratory gun firing at a wedding ceremony in the Naurangabad village of Lakhimpur Kheri, Uttar Pradesh. According to the police, the deceased was shot in his stomach while dancing and was immediately taken to the nearby district hospital where the doctors referred him to Lucknow. The deceased succumbed to his injuries on the way.

392.title: Scientists breed US coral species under threat by new disease
392.article_body: Scientists of the Florida Coral Rescue Center have successfully bred the rough cactus coral species off the coast of Florida that is under threat by a relatively new disease. The disease, called Stony Coral Tissue Loss Disease, takes away corals' colour and ultimately its life altogether. The centre has bred hundreds of rough cactus coral at a 2,000-square-foot facility.

393.title: Umar Khalid's Amravati speech was offensive and hateful: Delhi HC
393.article_body: Umar Khalid's speech at Amravati in February 2020 in connection with the larger conspiracy case related to the Northeast Delhi riots was offensive and hateful, Delhi High Court said. "These expressions being used, don't you think they incite people?" HC added. Delhi HC was hearing Khalid's appeal against the dismissal of his bail plea by a lower court.

394.title: Jharkhand HC grants bail to RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in fodder scam case
394.article_body: Jharkhand High Court on Friday granted bail to Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the ₹139.35-crore Doranda Treasury case, the fifth case against him in connection with the fodder scam. "We had pleaded that he has served half of his five-year sentence in this case,"  Yadav's counsel said. "CBI opposed the plea...HC granted bail," the counsel added.

395.title: Raj Kundra wears dress completely covering his face, gets trolled after video goes viral
395.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra has been trolled after he was seen wearing a dress completely covering his face in a viral video. Commenting on the video, social media users wrote, "People like him have no option other than hiding face," and "He is looking like Jaadu from Koi... Mil Gaya." He was seen wearing a similar attire in March.

396.title: Benched by DC in every IPL match so far, Sakariya shares excerpt from Anderson's book
396.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya, who's yet to play an IPL 2022 match, shared an excerpt from England pacer James Anderson's book. In the excerpt, Anderson talked about how he wanted to go back from Caribbean and play county after not getting a match in T20 World Cup 2010. "Painful experience has taught me there's nothing worse than...[net bowling]," Anderson wrote.

397.title: Saini was silent like in graveyard, said '300 runs should be enough': Ashwin on KKR match
397.article_body: Recalling the dugout atmosphere during their innings against KKR, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin revealed Navdeep Saini asked him what a safe total should be. "[I said 230...after which] Saini...was silent like in graveyard...He said, 'Bhaiya, I was having...deep contemplation and I think 300 should really be enough'," Ashwin added. Ashwin further said that he made them "burst into laughter".

398.title: TN govt to grant 270-day leave to women staff having children via surrogacy
398.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister for Social Welfare and Women Empowerment P Geetha Jeevan announced in the Assembly that women government employees and teachers, who have children via surrogacy, will be provided a 'child maintenance leave' for 270 days. "This is to help women government employees to take care of newborns delivered through surrogacy," the minister added.

399.title: 2 K'taka hijab case petitioners not allowed to take exam wearing burqas
399.article_body: Two petitioners in the hijab case were on Friday not allowed to take their final Class 12 board examination at Vidyodaya PU College in Karnataka's Udupi after they insisted on wearing burqas. The students reportedly tried to convince the invigilators and principal for around 45 minutes, but were refused any exception to Karnataka High Court's order upholding the hijab ban.

400.title: NITI Aayog, UNICEF India sign pact on SDGs focusing on children
400.article_body: NITI Aayog and UNICEF India have signed a statement of intent (SoI) on sustainable development goals (SDGs) with a focus on children. Together, they will work on the country's first report on multidimensional child development, focusing on health, education, sanitation and nutritional aspects. The report will also analyse recent children-related trends, a government statement said.

401.title: 4 trapped in lift rescued after fire breaks out at Delhi wedding hall
401.article_body: Four people were trapped in a lift after a fire broke out at Green Lawns Fashion Marriage Hall in Outer Delhi's GT Karnal Road on Thursday night. Delhi Fire Service personnel rescued the people including three senior citizens by cutting the upper part of the lift and pulling them out. Four fire tenders were deployed to douse the fire.

402.title: Athiya, KL Rahul to live together in ₹10 lakh/month rented house: Report
402.article_body: Actress Athiya Shetty is set to move in with her rumoured boyfriend cricketer KL Rahul in a 4BHK apartment in Mumbai, as per a report. It also stated that the rented apartment will cost ₹10 lakh per month and is located at Carter Road. The couple is said to have been dating for the last three years.
